p: These ideas were based on the observations of Denis Burkitt that many Western diseases that are rare in Africa, such as colorectal cancer, are strongly impacted by diet and lifestyle ( Burkitt, 1979). Burkitt suggested that fibre was an important dietary component for gut health, a view now widely accepted by nutritionists. The F-plan diet suggested that high fibre reduced the digestibility of the food eaten and prevented the absorption of many macronutrients, especially sugars and fats, so facilitating weight loss while maintaining satiation after high-fibre meals.
